AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: Support/automation responses include templated filler and generic troubleshooting that did not match the actual backend defect (email case-sensitivity). This created misdirection before the real root cause was found and fixed.
evidence: “Dear Andrew, Thank you for contacting the StreetSmart Support Team. We understand that the customer Florida Department of Health is unable to add devices using ATLAS.”
“Could you please ask the user to clear cache and cookies, restart the browser and relogin to support portal and try again (or possibly try from another browser)?”
“We identified that the issue was related to case sensitivity in the customer's email address during the automation process. This has now been resolved.”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer was routed into repeated/basic steps (e.g., cache/browser resets) and additional information requests after support couldn’t reproduce, despite the issue being account/email mapping related—creating a loop before escalation/fix.
evidence: “We were unable to reproduce the issue impersonating one of the admin accounts for COID 104983.”
“Could you please ask the user to clear cache and cookies, restart the browser and relogin… (or possibly try from another browser)?”
Customer: “I cleared the cache, installed Google Chrome, tested with Chrome, and still get the same error.  Tried different computers as well.”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support suggested client-side cache/browser troubleshooting even after internal notes indicated there is no caching for the email/gsheet mapping, and the symptom pointed to backend identity handling rather than browser state.
evidence: Support: “Could you please ask the user to clear cache and cookies, restart the browser…”
Internal note: “No kind of refresh is needed after updating the gsheet. There is no caching for the gsheet anywhere.”
Customer: “Tried different computers as well. I would be happy to replicate it for them on a call… since they weren’t able to replicate it.”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: No customer-to-support response gap exceeds 2 calendar days; replies generally occurred within the same day or next day.

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket was not closed while the customer was awaiting action; the thread continues through investigation and a deployed fix.

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The issue was marked urgent and described as blocking device additions/licensing, yet initial handling included standard client-side troubleshooting and extended back-and-forth before identifying a clear server-side automation defect.
evidence: Customer: “The customer is unable to add any devices… I need the licenses activated so they can proceed.”
Support: “Could you please ask the user to clear cache and cookies… try from another browser)?”
Resolution indicates backend defect: “issue was related to case sensitivity in the customer's email address during the automation process. This has now been resolved.”
